intro: Galium heldreichii var. obovatum, commonly known as the Balkan bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It features slender, ascending stems that are often hairy and bear opposite, lanceolate to obovate leaves. The small, white to pale pink flowers are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences, typical of the Rubiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. The plant is characterized by its aromatic foliage and is often found in mountainous regions of southeastern Europe.
